arabicText: فَٱسْتَجَابَ لَهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ أَنِّى لَآ أُضِيعُ عَمَلَ عَـٰمِلٍۢ مِّنكُم مِّن ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنثَىٰ ۖ بَعْضُكُم مِّنۢ بَعْضٍۢ ۖ فَٱلَّذِينَ هَاجَرُوا۟ وَأُخْرِجُوا۟ مِن دِيَـٰرِهِمْ وَأُوذُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِى وَقَـٰتَلُوا۟ وَقُتِلُوا۟ لَأُكَفِّرَنَّ عَنْهُمْ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمْ وَلَأُدْخِلَنَّهُمْ جَنَّـٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ثَوَابًۭا مِّنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عِندَهُۥ حُسْنُ ٱلثَّوَابِ
englishTranslationText:
So	 their	 Lord	accepted	 their	 prayer,	 for	 I	
do	not	waste	the	efforts	of	any	(righteous)	
worker,	 male	 or	 female;	 you	 are	 all	 one	
among	yourselves;	so	those	who	migrated	
and	 were	 driven	 out	 from	 their	 homes	
and	 were	 harassed	 in	 My	 cause,	 and	
fought,	 and	 were	 slain	 - I	 will	 certainly	
wipe	 out	 all	 their	 sins	 and	 will	 certainly	
admit	 them	 into	 Gardens	 beneath	 which	
rivers	flow;	a	reward	from	Allah;	and	only	
with	Allah is	the	best	reward.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unki	du'a	sun	li	un	ke	Rab	ne	ke	maiñ	
tum	meiñ	kām	wāle	ki	mehnat	akārat	nahi	
karta	mard	ho	yā	aurat	tum	āpas	meiñ	ek	
ho	 to	 woh	 jinhoñ	 ne	 hijrat	 ki	 aur	 apne	
gharoñ	 se	 nikāle	 gaye	 aur	 lade	 aur	 māre	
gaye	 maiñ	 zaroor	 un	 ke	 sab	 gunāh	 utār	
dooñ	 ga	 aur	 zaroor	 unheiñ	 bāghoñ	 meiñ	
le	jāuñ	ga	jin	ke	neeche	nahre	rawāñ	Allah	
ke	 pās	 ka	 sawāb	 aur	 Allah	 hi	 ke	 pās	
achcha	sawāb	hai

arabicText: لَا يَغُرَّنَّكَ تَقَلُّبُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْبِلَـٰدِ
englishTranslationText:
O	 listener	(followers	 of	 this	 Prophet)!	 Do	
not	ever	 be	 deceived	 by	 the	 disbelievers’	
free	movements	in	the	cities.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	sun	ne	wāle	kāfiroñ	ka	shahroñ	meiñ	
ahle	 gahle	 (Itrāte)	 phirna	 hargiz	 tujhe	
dhoka	na	de

arabicText: مَتَـٰعٌۭ قَلِيلٌۭ ثُمَّ مَأْوَىٰهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۚ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمِهَادُ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	a	brief	usage;	 their	home	is	hell;	and	
what	an	evil	resting-place!	.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Thoda	 baratna	 hai	 phir	 unka	 thikāna	
dozakh	hai	aur	kiya	hi	burā	bichauna

arabicText: لَـٰكِنِ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوْا۟ رَبَّهُمْ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتٌۭ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا نُزُلًۭا مِّنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَمَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ خَيْرٌۭ لِّلْأَبْرَارِ ١٩٨
englishTranslationText:
But	 for	 those	 who	 fear	 their	 Lord	 are	
Gardens	 beneath	 which	 rivers	 flow	 -
abiding	in	it	for	ever	- the	hospitality	from	
their	Lord;	and	that	which	is	with	Allah,	is	
the	best	for	the	righteous.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Lekin	woh jo	apne	Rab	se	darte	haiñ	un	ke	
liye	 Jannateiñ	 haiñ	 jin	 ke	 neeche	 nahre	
baheiñ	 hamesha	 un	 meiñ	 raheiñ	 Allah	 ki	
taraf	 ki	 mehmāni	 aur	 jo	 Allah	 ke	 pās	 hai	
woh	nekoñ	ke	liye	sab	se	bhalā

arabicText: وَإِنَّ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَمَن يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْهِمْ خَـٰشِعِينَ لِلَّهِ لَا يَشْتَرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ثَمَنًۭا قَلِيلًا ۗ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَرِيعُ ٱلْحِسَابِ
englishTranslationText:
And	 undoubtedly	 there	 are	 some	 among	
the	People	given	 the	Book(s),	who	accept	
faith	 in	 Allah and	 what	 is	 sent	 down	 to	
you	 and	 what	 was	 sent	 down	 to	 them	 -
their	hearts	are	submitted	humbly	before	
Allah - they	do	not	exchange	the	verses	of	
Allah for	 an	 abject	 price;	 they	 are	 those	
whose	 reward	 is	 with	 their	 Lord;	 indeed	
Allah is	Swift	At	Taking	Account.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	beshak	kuch	kitābi	aise	haiñ	ke	Allah	par	Imān	lāte	haiñ	aur	us	par jo	tumhāri	taraf	utra	un	
ke	dil	Allah	ke	huzoor	jhuke	huwe	Allah	ki	āyatoñ	ke	badle	zaleel	dām	nahi	lete	yeh	woh	haiñ	jin	
ka	sawāb	un	ke	Rab	ke	pās	hai	aur	Allah	jald	hisāb	karne	wāla	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱصْبِرُوا۟ وَصَابِرُوا۟ وَرَابِطُوا۟ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	Endure	and	surpass	your	enemies	in	endurance,	and	guard	the	frontiers	
of	the	Islamic	nation;	and	keep	fearing	Allah,	hoping	that	you	may	succeed
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	sabr	karo	aur	sabr	meiñ	dushmanoñ	se	āge	raho	aur	sarhad	par	Islāmi	mulk	ki	
nigehbāni	karo	aur	Allah	se	darte	raho	is	ummeed	par	ke	kāmyāb	ho.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ ٱتَّقُوا۟ رَبَّكُمُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكُم مِّن نَّفْسٍۢ وَٰحِدَةٍۢ وَخَلَقَ مِنْهَا زَوْجَهَا وَبَثَّ مِنْهُمَا رِجَالًۭا كَثِيرًۭا وَنِسَآءًۭ ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِى تَسَآءَلُونَ بِهِۦ وَٱلْأَرْحَامَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلَيْكُمْ رَقِيبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	mankind!	 Fear	 your	 Lord	Who	 created	
you	from	a	single	soul	and	from	it	created	
its	spouse	and	from	them	both	has	spread	
the	 multitude	 of	 men	 and	 women;	 fear	
Allah in	 Whose	 name	 you	 claim	 (your	
rights	 from	 one	 another)	 and	 be	 mindful	
of	 your	 blood	 relations;	 indeed	 Allah is	
always	seeing	you
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	logoñ!	apne	Rab	se	daro	jis	ne	tumheiñ	
ek	jān	se	paida	kiya	aur	usi	meiñ	se	us	ka	
joda	banāya	aur	un	donoñ	se	bahut	mard	o	
aurat	 phailā	 diye	 aur	 Allah	 se	 daro	 jis	 ke	
nām	 par	 māñgte	 ho	 aur	 rishtoñ	 ka	 lihāz	
rakho	 beshak	 Allah	 har	 waqt	 tumheiñ	
dekh	rahā	hai.

arabicText: وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلْيَتَـٰمَىٰٓ أَمْوَٰلَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا تَتَبَدَّلُوا۟ ٱلْخَبِيثَ بِٱلطَّيِّبِ ۖ وَلَا تَأْكُلُوٓا۟ أَمْوَٰلَهُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَمْوَٰلِكُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ حُوبًۭا كَبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	give	the	orphans	their	wealth	and	do	
not	exchange	the	pure	for	the	foul;	and	do	
not	 devour	 (or	 use	 up)	 their	 wealth,	
mixing	it	with	 your	 own;	 this	is	indeed	a	
great	sin
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 yateemoñ	ko	un	ke	māl	do	aur	suthre	
ke	 badle	 ganda	 na	 lo	 aur	 un	 ke	 māl	 apne	
māloñ	 meiñ	 mila	 kar	 na	 kha	 jāo	 beshak	
yeh	badā	gunāh	hai.

arabicText: وَإِنْ خِفْتُمْ أَلَّا تُقْسِطُوا۟ فِى ٱلْيَتَـٰمَىٰ فَٱنكِحُوا۟ مَا طَابَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلنِّسَآءِ مَثْنَىٰ وَثُلَـٰثَ وَرُبَـٰعَ ۖ فَإِنْ خِفْتُمْ أَلَّا تَعْدِلُوا۟ فَوَٰحِدَةً أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَـٰنُكُمْ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ أَدْنَىٰٓ أَلَّا تَعُولُوا۟ ٣
englishTranslationText:
And	 if	 you	 fear	 that	 you	 will	 not	 be	 just	
towards	 orphan	 girls,	 marry	 the	 women	
whom	you	like	- two	at	a	time,	or	three	or	
four;	then	if	you	fear	that	you	cannot	keep	
two	women	equally	 then	marry	 only	 one	
or	the	bondwomen	you	own; this	is	closer	
to	your	not	doing	injustice.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 agar	 tumheiñ	 andesha	 ho	 ke	 yateem	
ladkiyoñ	 meiñ	 insāf	 na	 karo	 ge	 to	 nikāh	
meiñ	 lāo	 jo	 aurteiñ	 tumheiñ	 Khush	 āyeiñ	
do	do	aur	teen	teen	aur	chār	chār	phir	agar	
daro	 ke	 do	 biwiyoñ	 ko	 barābar	 na	 rakh	
sakoge	to	ek	hi	karo	ya	kanizeiñ	jin	ke	tum	
mālik	ho	ye	us	se	ziyāda	qareeb	hai	ke	tum	
se	zulm	na	ho

arabicText: وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلنِّسَآءَ صَدُقَـٰتِهِنَّ نِحْلَةًۭ ۚ فَإِن طِبْنَ لَكُمْ عَن شَىْءٍۢ مِّنْهُ نَفْسًۭا فَكُلُوهُ هَنِيٓـًۭٔا مَّرِيٓـًۭٔا
englishTranslationText:
And	 give	 the	 women	 their	 bridal	 money	
willingly;	then	if	they	willingly	give	you	a	
part	of	it,	eat	(use)	it	with	joy	and	fruition
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 aurtoñ	 ko	 un	 ke	 maher	 khushi	 se	 do	
phir	agar	woh	apne	dil	ki	khushi	se	Maher	
meiñ	 se	 tumheiñ	 kuch	 de	 deiñ	 to	 usey	
khāo	 rachta	 pachta	 (Khush	 gawār	 aur	
maze	se)

arabicText: وَلَا تُؤْتُوا۟ ٱلسُّفَهَآءَ أَمْوَٰلَكُمُ ٱلَّتِى جَعَلَ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمْ قِيَـٰمًۭا وَٱرْزُقُوهُمْ فِيهَا وَٱكْسُوهُمْ وَقُولُوا۟ لَهُمْ قَوْلًۭا مَّعْرُوفًۭا
englishTranslationText:
. And	 do	 not	 give	 the	 foolish	 their	 wealth	
which	is	in	your	custody	- those	for	whom	
Allah has	 put	 you	 in	 charge	 to	 maintain	
(look	 after)	 - and	 feed	 and	 clothe	 them	
from	it,	and	speak	kindly	to	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be-aqloñ	 ko	 un	 ke	 māl	 na	 do	 jo	
tumhāre	 pās	 haiñ	jin	 ko	 Allah	 ne	 tumhāri	
basare	auqāt	kiya	hai	aur	unheiñ	us	meiñ	se	khilāo	aur	pahnāo	aur	un	se	achchi	bāt	kaho

arabicText: وَٱبْتَلُوا۟ ٱلْيَتَـٰمَىٰ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغُوا۟ ٱلنِّكَاحَ فَإِنْ ءَانَسْتُم مِّنْهُمْ رُشْدًۭا فَٱدْفَعُوٓا۟ إِلَيْهِمْ أَمْوَٰلَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا تَأْكُلُوهَآ إِسْرَافًۭا وَبِدَارًا أَن يَكْبَرُوا۟ ۚ وَمَن كَانَ غَنِيًّۭا فَلْيَسْتَعْفِفْ ۖ وَمَن كَانَ فَقِيرًۭا فَلْيَأْكُلْ بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ ۚ فَإِذَا دَفَعْتُمْ إِلَيْهِمْ أَمْوَٰلَهُمْ فَأَشْهِدُوا۟ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ حَسِيبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 test	 the	 orphans	 till	 they	are	 fit	 to	get	married	(reach	full	 age);	 then	if	 you	 find	 them	 of	
proper	 judgement,	 hand	 over	 their	 wealth	 to	 them;	 and	 do	 not	 devour	 it	 by	 spending	
excessively	and	hastily,	fearing	that	they	will	grow	up;	and	whoever	is	not	in	need	must	abstain;	
and	whoever	is	needy	may	use	from	it	in	a	reasonable	measure;	and	when	you	hand	over	their	
wealth	to	them,	get	witnesses	over	them;	and	Allah is	Sufficient	to	take	account.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yateemoñ	ko	āzmāte	raho	yahāñ	 tak	ke	jab	woh	nikāh	ke	qābil	hoñ	 to	agar	 tum	un	ki	samajh	 theek	
dekho	to	un	ke	māl	unheiñ	supurd	kardo	aur	unheiñ	na	khāo	had	se	badh	kar	aur	is	jaldi	meiñ	ke	kahiñ	
bade	na	ho	jāyeñ	aur	jise	hājat	na	ho	woh	bachta	rahe	aur	jo	hājat	mand	ho	woh	ba-qadr-e-munāsib	khāye	
phir	jab	tum	un	ke	māl	unheiñ	supurd	karo	to	un	par		guwāh	kar	lo	aur	Allah	kāfi	hai	hisāb	lene	ko.

arabicText: لِّلرِّجَالِ نَصِيبٌۭ مِّمَّا تَرَكَ ٱلْوَٰلِدَانِ وَٱلْأَقْرَبُونَ وَلِلنِّسَآءِ نَصِيبٌۭ مِّمَّا تَرَكَ ٱلْوَٰلِدَانِ وَٱلْأَقْرَبُونَ مِمَّا قَلَّ مِنْهُ أَوْ كَثُرَ ۚ نَصِيبًۭا مَّفْرُوضًۭا
englishTranslationText:
For	men	is	a	share	from	what	the	parents	
and	 near	 relatives	 leave	 behind,	 and	 for	
women	is	a	 share	 from	what	 the	 parents	
and	 near	 relatives	leave	 behind,	 whether	
the	wealth	(inheritance)	is	small	or	large;	
the	share	is	a	fixed	one.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mardoñ	 ke	 liye	 hissa	 hai	 us	 meiñ	 se	 jo	
chord	 gaye	 mā	 bāp	 aur	 qrābat	 wāle,	 aur	
aurtoñ	 ke	 liye	 hissa	 hai	 us	 meiñ	 se	 jo	
chord	gaye	mā	bāp	aur	qrābat	wāle,	tarka	
thoda	 ho	 ya bahut,	 hissa	 hai	 andāza	
bāñdha	huwa

arabicText: وَلْيَخْشَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَوْ تَرَكُوا۟ مِنْ خَلْفِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّةًۭ ضِعَـٰفًا خَافُوا۟ عَلَيْهِمْ فَلْيَتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَلْيَقُولُوا۟ قَوْلًۭا سَدِيدًا
englishTranslationText:
. And	 those	 people	 must	 fear,	 who	 if	 they	
die	 leaving	 behind	 them	 young	 children	
would	 be	 afraid	 for	 them;	 so	 they	 must	
fear	Allah and	speak	with	fairness.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 dareiñ	 woh	 log	 ke	 agar	 apne	 b'ad	
natuwāñ	 aulād	 chordte	 to	 un	 ka	 kaisa	
unheiñ	khatra	hota	to	chāhiye	ke	Allah	se	
dareiñ	aur	seedhi	bāt	kareiñ

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَأْكُلُونَ أَمْوَٰلَ ٱلْيَتَـٰمَىٰ ظُلْمًا إِنَّمَا يَأْكُلُونَ فِى بُطُونِهِمْ نَارًۭا ۖ وَسَيَصْلَوْنَ سَعِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 those	 who	 unjustly	 devour	 the	
wealth	 of	 orphans	 only	 fill	 their	 bellies	
with	 fire;	 and	 soon	 they	 will	 go	 into	 a	
blazing	pit.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Woh	 jo	 yateemoñ	 ka	 māl	 na-haq	 khāte	
haiñ	woh	 to	apne	pet	meiñ	niri	āg	bharte	
haiñ	 aur	 koi	 dam	 jāta	 hai	 ke	 bhadakte	
dhade	(Bhadakti	Āg) meiñ	jāyeñ	ge

arabicText: يُوصِيكُمُ ٱللَّهُ فِىٓ أَوْلَـٰدِكُمْ ۖ لِلذَّكَرِ مِثْلُ حَظِّ ٱلْأُنثَيَيْنِ ۚ فَإِن كُنَّ نِسَآءًۭ فَوْقَ ٱثْنَتَيْنِ فَلَهُنَّ ثُلُثَا مَا تَرَكَ ۖ وَإِن كَانَتْ وَٰحِدَةًۭ فَلَهَا ٱلنِّصْفُ ۚ وَلِأَبَوَيْهِ لِكُلِّ وَٰحِدٍۢ مِّنْهُمَا ٱلسُّدُسُ مِمَّا تَرَكَ إِن كَانَ لَهُۥ وَلَدٌۭ ۚ فَإِن لَّمْ يَكُن لَّهُۥ وَلَدٌۭ وَوَرِثَهُۥٓ أَبَوَاهُ فَلِأُمِّهِ ٱلثُّلُثُ ۚ فَإِن كَانَ لَهُۥٓ إِخْوَةٌۭ فَلِأُمِّهِ ٱلسُّدُسُ ۚ مِنۢ بَعْدِ وَصِيَّةٍۢ يُوصِى بِهَآ أَوْ دَيْنٍ ۗ ءَابَآؤُكُمْ وَأَبْنَآؤُكُمْ لَا تَدْرُونَ أَيُّهُمْ أَقْرَبُ لَكُمْ نَفْعًۭا ۚ فَرِيضَةًۭ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
. Allah commands	 you	 concerning	 your	
children;	the	son’s	share	is	equal	to	that	of	
two	 daughters;	 and	 if	 there	 are	 only	
daughters,	 for	 them	 is	 two-thirds	 of	 the	
inheritance,	 even	 if	 they	 are	 more	 than	
two;	and	if	there	is	only	one	daughter,	for	
her	is	 half;	 and	 to	 each	 of	 the	 deceased’s	
parents	a	sixth	of	the	inheritance,	if	he	has	
children;	 and	 if	 the	 deceased	 has	 no	
children	but	leaves	behind	parents,	then	one	third	for	the	mother;	and	if	he	has	several	brothers	
and	sisters,	a	sixth	for	the	mother,	after	any	will	he	may	have	made	and	payment	of	debt;	your	
fathers	and	your	sons	- you	do	not	know	which	of	them	will	be	more	useful	to	you;	this	is	the	
share	fixed	by	Allah;	indeed	Allah is	All	Knowing,	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	tumheiñ	hukm	deta	hai	tumhāri	aulād	ke	bāre	meiñ	bete	ka	hissa	do	betiyoñ	barābar	phir	
agar	niri	ladkiyāñ	hoñ	agarche	do	se	upar	to	un	ko	tarke	ki	do	tehāi	aur	agar	ek	ladki	to	uska	
ādha	aur	mayyat	ke	mā	bāp	ko	har	ek	ko	uske	tarke	se	chata agar	mayyat	ke	aulād	ho	phir	agar	
us	ki	aulād	na	ho	aur	mā	bāp	chorde	to	mā	ka	tehāi	phir	agar	us	ke	kayi	behen	bhāi	hoñ	to	mā	
ka	chata	b'ad	us	wasiyat	ke	jo	kar	gaya	aur	dain	ke	tumhāre	bāp	aur	tumhāre	bete	tum	kya	jāno	
ke	 un	 meiñ	 kaun	 tumhāre	 ziyāda	 kām	 āye	 ga	 yeh	 hissa	 bāñdha	 huwa	 hai	 Allah	 ki	 taraf	 se,
beshak	Allah	ilm	wāla	hikmat	wāla	hai

arabicText: ۞ وَلَكُمْ نِصْفُ مَا تَرَكَ أَزْوَٰجُكُمْ إِن لَّمْ يَكُن لَّهُنَّ وَلَدٌۭ ۚ فَإِن كَانَ لَهُنَّ وَلَدٌۭ فَلَكُمُ ٱلرُّبُعُ مِمَّا تَرَكْنَ ۚ مِنۢ بَعْدِ وَصِيَّةٍۢ يُوصِينَ بِهَآ أَوْ دَيْنٍۢ ۚ وَلَهُنَّ ٱلرُّبُعُ مِمَّا تَرَكْتُمْ إِن لَّمْ يَكُن لَّكُمْ وَلَدٌۭ ۚ فَإِن كَانَ لَكُمْ وَلَدٌۭ فَلَهُنَّ ٱلثُّمُنُ مِمَّا تَرَكْتُم ۚ مِّنۢ بَعْدِ وَصِيَّةٍۢ تُوصُونَ بِهَآ أَوْ دَيْنٍۢ ۗ وَإِن كَانَ رَجُلٌۭ يُورَثُ كَلَـٰلَةً أَوِ ٱمْرَأَةٌۭ وَلَهُۥٓ أَخٌ أَوْ أُخْتٌۭ فَلِكُلِّ وَٰحِدٍۢ مِّنْهُمَا ٱلسُّدُسُ ۚ فَإِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَكْثَرَ مِن ذَٰلِكَ فَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فِى ٱلثُّلُثِ ۚ مِنۢ بَعْدِ وَصِيَّةٍۢ يُوصَىٰ بِهَآ أَوْ دَيْنٍ غَيْرَ مُضَآرٍّۢ ۚ وَصِيَّةًۭ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 from	 what	 your	 wives	 leave,	 half	 is	
for	you	if	they	do	not	have	any	child;	or	if	
they	 have	 a	 child	 for	 you	 is	 a	 fourth	 of	
what	 they	 leave,	 after	 any	 will	 they	 may	
have	made	or	debt	 to	be	paid;	and	 to	 the	
women	 is	 a	 fourth	 of	 what	 you	 leave	
behind,	if	you	do	not	have	any	child;	or	if	
you	 have	 a	 child	 then	 an	 eighth	 of	 what	
you	leave	 behind,	 after	 any	will	 you	may	
have	 made,	 or	 debt	 to	 be	 paid;	 and	 if	 a	
deceased	does	not	leave	behind	a	mother,	
father	 or	 children	 but	 has	 a	 brother	 or	 a	
sister	 through	a	common	mother,	 then	 to	
each	of	them	a	sixth;	and	if	they	(brothers	
and	sisters)	are	more	 than	 two,	 then	 they	
shall	all	share	in	a	third,	after	any	will	that	
may	have	been	made	or	debt	to	be	paid,	in	
which	the	deceased	has	not	caused	a	loss	
(to	 the	 heirs);	 this	 is	 the	 decree	 of	Allah;	
and	 Allah is	 All	 Knowing,	 Most	
Forbearing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tumhāri	 biwiyāñ	 jo	 chord	 jāyeñ	 us	
meiñ	se	tumheiñ	ādha	hai	agar	un	ki	aulād	
na	 ho	 to	 un	 ke	 tarke	 meiñ	 se	 tumheiñ	
chauthāi	hai	jo	wasiyat	woh	kar	gayiñ	aur	
dain	 nikāl	 kar	 aur	 tumhāre	 tarke	 meiñ	
aurtoñ	 ka	 chauthāi	 hai	 agar	 tumhāre	
aulād	na	ho	phir	agar	tumhāre	aulād	ho	to	
un	 ka	 tumhāre	 tarke	 meiñ	 se	 āthwāñ	 jo	
wasiyyat	 tum	 kar	 jāo	 aur	 dain	 nikāl	 kar	
aur	agar	 kisi	aise	mard	 ya	aurat	 ka	 tarka	
bat-ta	 ho	 jis	 ne	 mā	 bāp	 aulād	 kuchh	 na	
chhode	 aur	 mā	 ki	 taraf	 se	 us	 ka	 bhāi	 ya	
bahen	hai	to	un	meiñ	se	har	ek	ko	chhatā	
phir	 agar	 woh	 bahen	 bhāi	 ek	 se	 ziyāda	
hoñ	to	sab	tihāi	meiñ	shareek	haiñ	mayyat	
ki	 wasiyat	 aur	 dain	 nikāl	 kar	 jis	 meiñ	 us	
ne	nuqsān	na	pahuñchāya	ho	yeh	Allah	ka	
irshād	 hai	 aur	 Allah	 ilm	 wāla	 hilm	 wāla	
hai.

arabicText: تِلْكَ حُدُودُ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يُطِعِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ يُدْخِلْهُ جَنَّـٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
These	are	the	limits	of	Allah;	and	whoever	
obeys	 Allah and	 His	 Noble	 Messenger	 -
Allah will	admit	him	into	Gardens	beneath	
which	 rivers	 flow	- abiding	 in	 it	 forever;	
and	this	is	the	great	success.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	Allah	ki	hadeiñ	haiñ	aur	jo	hukm	māne	Allah	ke	aur	Allah	ke	Rasool	ka	Allah	usey	bāghoñ	
meiñ	le	jāye	ga	jin	ke	neeche	nahre	rawāñ	hamesha	un	meiñ	raheñ	ge	aur	yahi	hai	badi	kāmyābi

arabicText: وَمَن يَعْصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ وَيَتَعَدَّ حُدُودَهُۥ يُدْخِلْهُ نَارًا خَـٰلِدًۭا فِيهَا وَلَهُۥ عَذَابٌۭ مُّهِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 whoever	 disobeys	 Allah and	 His	
Noble	Messenger	and	crosses	all	His	limits	- Allah will	put	him	in	the	fire	(of	hell),	in	which	he	
will	remain	forever;	and	for	him	is	a	disgraceful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	Allah	aur	us	ke	Rasool	ki	na-farmāni	kare	aur	us	ki	kul	hadoñ	se	badh	jāye	Allah	usey	āag	
meiñ	dākhil	karega	jis	meiñ	hameshā	rahega	aur	us	ke	liye	khuwāri	ka	‘azāb	hai

arabicText: وَٱلَّـٰتِى يَأْتِينَ ٱلْفَـٰحِشَةَ مِن نِّسَآئِكُمْ فَٱسْتَشْهِدُوا۟ عَلَيْهِنَّ أَرْبَعَةًۭ مِّنكُمْ ۖ فَإِن شَهِدُوا۟ فَأَمْسِكُوهُنَّ فِى ٱلْبُيُوتِ حَتَّىٰ يَتَوَفَّىٰهُنَّ ٱلْمَوْتُ أَوْ يَجْعَلَ ٱللَّهُ لَهُنَّ سَبِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	take	testimony	from	four	chosen	men	
amongst	 you,	 against	 the	 women	 among	
you	 who	 commit	 adultery;	 and	 if	 they	
testify,	 confine	 those	 women	 in	 the	
houses	 until	 death	 takes	 them	 away	 or	
Allah creates	a	solution	for	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
5. Aur	 tumhāri	 aurtoñ	 meiñ	 jo	 badkāri	
kareiñ	 un	 par	 khās	 apne	 meiñ	 ke	 chār	
mardoñ	 ki	 gawāhi	 lo	 phir	 agar	 woh	
gawāhi	 de	 deiñ	 to	 un	 aurtoñ	 ko	 ghar	
meiñ	 band	 rakho	 yahāñ	 tak	 ke	 unheiñ	
maut	 uthā	 le	 ya Allah	 un	 ki	 kuchh	 rāh	
nikāle

arabicText: وَٱلَّذَانِ يَأْتِيَـٰنِهَا مِنكُمْ فَـَٔاذُوهُمَا ۖ فَإِن تَابَا وَأَصْلَحَا فَأَعْرِضُوا۟ عَنْهُمَآ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ تَوَّابًۭا رَّحِيمًا
englishTranslationText:
And	 punish	 them	 both,	 the	 man	 and	 the	
woman,	 whoever	 are	 guilty	 of	 it	
(adultery);	then	if	they	repent	and	become	
pious,	 leave	 them;	 indeed	 Allah is	 the	
Most	 Acceptor	 Of	 Repentance,	 Most	
Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tum	 meiñ	 jo	 mard	 aurat	 aisa	 kām	
kareiñ	un	ko	izā	do	phir	agar	woh	tauba	
kar	leñ	aur	nek	ho	jāyeñ	to	unka	peecha	
chhod	 do	 beshak	 Allah	 badā	 tauba	
qabool	karne	wāla	maherbān	hai

arabicText: إِنَّمَا ٱلتَّوْبَةُ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ لِلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلسُّوٓءَ بِجَهَـٰلَةٍۢ ثُمَّ يَتُوبُونَ مِن قَرِيبٍۢ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَتُوبُ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Undoubtedly	 the	 repentance	 which	Allah
has	 by	 His	 grace	 made	 obligatory	 upon	
Himself	 to	 accept,	is	 only	 the	 repentance	
of	those	who	commit	sin	in	folly	and	then	
soon	 repent	 - towards	 them	 does	 Allah
incline	 in	 mercy;	 and	 Allah is	 the	 All	
Knowing,	the	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	 tauba	jiska	 qubool	 karna	Allah	
ne	apne fazl	se	lāzim	kar	liya	hai	woh	un	
hi	 ki	hai	jo	na	dāni	se	burāi	 kar	baitheñ	
phir	 thodi	 hi	 der	 meiñ	 tauba	 kar	 leñ	
aisoñ	 par	 Allah	 apni	 rahmat	 se	 ruju'	
karta	hai	aur	Allah	ilm	o	hikmat	wāla	hai.

arabicText: وَلَيْسَتِ ٱلتَّوْبَةُ لِلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا حَضَرَ أَحَدَهُمُ ٱلْمَوْتُ قَالَ إِنِّى تُبْتُ ٱلْـَٔـٰنَ وَلَا ٱلَّذِينَ يَمُوتُونَ وَهُمْ كُفَّارٌ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَعْتَدْنَا لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 that	 repentance	 is	 not	 of	 those	 who	
constantly	 commit	 sins,	 and	 when	 death	
approaches one	of	them,	he	says,	“I	repent	
now”,	 nor	 of	 those	 who	 die	 as	
disbelievers;	 for	 them,	 We	 have	 kept	
prepared	a	painful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 woh	 Tauba	 un	 ki	 nahi	 jo	 gunāhoñ	
meiñ	lage	rahte	haiñ	yahāñ	tak	ke	jab	un	
meiñ	kisi	ko	maut	āaye	 to	kahe	ab	maiñ	
ne	 tauba	 ki	aur	na	 ki	jo	 kāfir	mareiñ	un	
ke	liye	ham	ne	dard-nāk	‘azāb	tayyār	kar	
rakha	hai

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا يَحِلُّ لَكُمْ أَن تَرِثُوا۟ ٱلنِّسَآءَ كَرْهًۭا ۖ وَلَا تَعْضُلُوهُنَّ لِتَذْهَبُوا۟ بِبَعْضِ مَآ ءَاتَيْتُمُوهُنَّ إِلَّآ أَن يَأْتِينَ بِفَـٰحِشَةٍۢ مُّبَيِّنَةٍۢ ۚ وَعَاشِرُوهُنَّ بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ ۚ فَإِن كَرِهْتُمُوهُنَّ فَعَسَىٰٓ أَن تَكْرَهُوا۟ شَيْـًۭٔا وَيَجْعَلَ ٱللَّهُ فِيهِ خَيْرًۭا كَثِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	 It	is	not	lawful	 for	
you	to	forcibly	become	the	women’s	heirs;	
and	 do	 not	 restrain	 women	 with	 the	
intention	 of	 taking	 away	 a	 part	 of	 bridal	
money	you	gave	them,	unless	they	openly	commit	the	shameful;	and	deal	kindly	with	them;	and	
if	 you	 do	 not	 like	 them,	 so	 it	 is	 possible	 that	 you	 dislike	 a	 thing	 in	 which	 Allah has	 placed	
abundant	good.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 Imān	 wālo	 tumheiñ	 halāl	 nahi	 ke	
aurtoñ	ke	wāris	ban	jāo	zabardasti	aur	aurtoñ	ko	roko	nahi	is	niyyat	se	ke	jo	maher	unko	diyā	
tha	 us	meiñ	 se	 kuchh	le	lo	magar	is	 surat	meiñ	 ke	 sareeh	 be-hayāi	 ka	 kām	 kareiñ	 aur	 un	 se	
achha	bartāo	karo	phir	agar	woh	tumheiñ	pasand	na	āyeñ	to	qareeb	hai	ke	koi	cheez	tumheiñ	
na	pasand	ho	aur	Allah	us	meiñ	bahut	bhalāi	rakhe

arabicText: وَإِنْ أَرَدتُّمُ ٱسْتِبْدَالَ زَوْجٍۢ مَّكَانَ زَوْجٍۢ وَءَاتَيْتُمْ إِحْدَىٰهُنَّ قِنطَارًۭا فَلَا تَأْخُذُوا۟ مِنْهُ شَيْـًٔا ۚ أَتَأْخُذُونَهُۥ بُهْتَـٰنًۭا وَإِثْمًۭا مُّبِينًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 if	 you	 wish	 to	 change	 one	 wife	 for	
another	and	 you	have	given	her	heaps	 of	
treasure,	 do	 not	 take	 back	anything	 from	
it;	 will	 you	 take	 it	 back	 by	 slander	 and	
open	sin?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 agar	 tum	 ek	 biwi	 ke	 badle	 doosri	
badalna	 chāho	 aur	 usey	 dheroñ	 māl	 de	
chuke	ho	 to	us	meiñ	se	kuch	wāpas	na	lo	
kya	usey	wāpas	loge	jhoot	bāndh	kar	aur	
khule	gunāh	se

arabicText: وَكَيْفَ تَأْخُذُونَهُۥ وَقَدْ أَفْضَىٰ بَعْضُكُمْ إِلَىٰ بَعْضٍۢ وَأَخَذْنَ مِنكُم مِّيثَـٰقًا غَلِيظًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 how	 will	 you	 take	 it	 back	 whereas	
you	 have	 become	 unveiled	 before	 each	
other,	 and	 they	 have	 taken	 a	 strong	
pledge	from	you?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 kiyuñ	 kar	 wāpas	 loge	 hālañ	 ke	 tum	
meiñ	ek	doosre	ke	sāmne	be-parda	ho	liya	
hai	aur	woh	tum	se	gādha	ahed	le	chukiñ

arabicText: وَلَا تَنكِحُوا۟ مَا نَكَحَ ءَابَآؤُكُم مِّنَ ٱلنِّسَآءِ إِلَّا مَا قَدْ سَلَفَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فَـٰحِشَةًۭ وَمَقْتًۭا وَسَآءَ سَبِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
And	 do	 not	 marry	 the	 women	 who	 were	
wedded	 to	 your	 fathers	 (and	 grand	
fathers),	except	what	has	already	passed;	
that	 is	 indeed	 an	 act	 of	 shame	 and	 great	
wrong;	and	an	evil	way.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 bāp	 dāda	 ki	 mankooha	 se	 nikāh	 na	
karo	 magar	 jo	 ho	 guzrā	 woh	 beshak	 behayāi	 aur	 ghazab	 ka	 kām	 hai	 aur	 bahut	
buri	rāh

arabicText: حُرِّمَتْ عَلَيْكُمْ أُمَّهَـٰتُكُمْ وَبَنَاتُكُمْ وَأَخَوَٰتُكُمْ وَعَمَّـٰتُكُمْ وَخَـٰلَـٰتُكُمْ وَبَنَاتُ ٱلْأَخِ وَبَنَاتُ ٱلْأُخْتِ وَأُمَّهَـٰتُكُمُ ٱلَّـٰتِىٓ أَرْضَعْنَكُمْ وَأَخَوَٰتُكُم مِّنَ ٱلرَّضَـٰعَةِ وَأُمَّهَـٰتُ نِسَآئِكُمْ وَرَبَـٰٓئِبُكُمُ ٱلَّـٰتِى فِى حُجُورِكُم مِّن نِّسَآئِكُمُ ٱلَّـٰتِى دَخَلْتُم بِهِنَّ فَإِن لَّمْ تَكُونُوا۟ دَخَلْتُم بِهِنَّ فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَحَلَـٰٓئِلُ أَبْنَآئِكُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ مِنْ أَصْلَـٰبِكُمْ وَأَن تَجْمَعُوا۟ بَيْنَ ٱلْأُخْتَيْنِ إِلَّا مَا قَدْ سَلَفَ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ غَفُورًۭا رَّحِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Forbidden	 for	 you	are	 your	mothers,	and	
your	 daughters,	 and	 your	 sisters,	 and	
your	 father’s	 sisters,	 and	 your	 mother’s	
sisters,	and	your	brothers’	daughters	and	
your	 sisters’	 daughters,	 and	 your	 fostermothers	 (who	 breast-fed	 you),	 and	 their	
daughters	 (your	 foster-sisters),	 and	 your	
wives’	 mothers	 (mothers-in-law),	 and	
your	 wives’	 daughters	 who	 are	 under	
your	protection	- born	of	the	women	with	
whom	 you	 have	 cohabited;	 and	 if	 you	
have	 not	 cohabited	 with	 them,	 then	 it	 is	
no	 sin	 for	 you	 to	 marry	 their	 daughters;	
and	 (forbidden	 are)	 the	 wives of	 your	 own	 sons	 (and	 foster-sons	 and	 grandsons)	 and	 the	
keeping	of	two	sisters	together	in	marriage,	except	what	has	already	passed;	indeed	Allah is	Oft	
Forgiving,	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Harām	huwiñ	tum	par	tumhāri	māyeñ	aur	
betiyāñ	 aur	 bahneiñ	 aur	 phuphiyāñ	 aur	
khālāyeiñ	 aur	 bhateejiyāñ	 aur	 bhānjiyāñ	
aur	 tumhāri māyeñ	 jinhoñ	 ne	 doodh	
pilāya	aur	doodh	ki	bahneiñ	aur	aurtoñ	ki	
māyeñ	aur	unki	betiyāñ jo	tumhāri	goad	meiñ	haiñ	un	biwiyoñ	se	jin	se	tum	sohbat	kar	chuke	
ho	phir	agar	 tum	ne	un	se	sohabat	na	ki	ho	 to	unki	betiyoñ	meiñ	koi	haraj	nahiñ	aur	 tumhāri	
nasli	betoñ	ki	biwiyāñ	aur	do	beheneiñ	ekhatti	karna	magar	jo	ho	guzra	beshak	Allah	bakhsh	ne	
wāla	maherbān	hai.
